content: The features are very nice, I like the ability to edit and add or remove as well as the adaptive learning.

content: Very good app at 3 stars. It could be a great app at 5 stars if DEV provided frequent updates with additional features.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! We've just released a new version (v2.5) that has a significant number of bug fixes and minor user interface improvements. We hope you consider increase the # of stars for your review!

content: Good to keep you refreshed. Use it like a game while having to wait some where.

content: Uninstalled. I don't need to know WHAT the most common medications are, I need help remembering what they DO. The flashcards just have the name of the drug on both sides? Not helpful.
replyContent: The flashcards are actually customizable! You can set generic, brand, drug class, indications, ADRs, dosing, or "all items" on the front and/or back when setting up the flashcard mode.

content: Great, but repeatedly crashes went attempting to open most drug group categories.

content: Handy enough study tool, except that it force closes EVERY time, if you use the quiz mode long enough. User interface is very well set up (much better than any of the other PTCB study apps I've tried so far) albeit hideously ugly. Really like the adaptive learning feature, ability to customize both quiz & flash card modes, & access to running stats. Summing up, this is one of at least five apps of its kind I've installed, & even in spite of the guaranteed eventual force close, I use this one by far the most
replyContent: I apologize for the force closing -- the bug causing this problem should be addressed with today's update (version 2.1)

content: Would be a perfect 5 if I could create my own list though and focus on only those drug cards
replyContent:
You can!  With the newest update, you can create a custom drug "group" and add any drugs to that group.

If you want to focus your studying, "hide" all other groups except for your custom drug group.  Hidden groups will not be eligible for flashcard or quiz mode.

Enjoy!

content: This app is fantastic for getting the big picture. It's helped me learn the major properties of the top drugs very quickly and easily from my phone, which has been great as a bus commuter. It unfortunately does not touch antibiotic coverage. It also won't hit all the 'high yield side effects' for USMLE if you're a med student, and mechanism of action is a bit low on info. The I'd say if your feeling lost on pharma, it's worth the $5.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback!  This app definitely does not cover mechanism of action or antimicrobial spectrum coverage -- it focuses more on brand/generic, drug class, indications, and adverse effects.  If you're looking for more study materials, consider our online course at http://top250drugs.com

content: The best
Very helpful whether you're studying for a pharmacy tech or other medical test or already working.  The pronunciations are a fantastic addition to an already great learning tool.
This app is big help for me as I work at a pharmacy.
Love it
But if it could be possible to choose more than 1 and not all the information about the drug  once the the card is flipped, that'd be great!
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback Alex.  It's definitely something we'll consider for future updates.

content: It is a great app to use! It has helped me out a lot. It's very convenient and helpful. :)

content: Nice layout

While I definitely found this app helpful, I wish you could actually add drugs in like it says in the description. With a little more database control, it would make for a fantastic flash card app for any number of uses.
replyContent: Hi Jared -- thanks for the feedback.  New drugs can be added by pressing your phone's "menu" button while in the Drug Database section.  We've just released an update to help make this process more intuitive on newer Android devices (which sometimes lack a physical menu button). Thanks!

replyContent: Brand name pronunciation added today (version 2.0)!

content: I like this app. I just wish it had auto for the correct Annunciation for generic and brand names .

replyContent: Thanks Heather -- we released a new update today (version 2.0) that adds 50 new drugs for a total of 250 drugs!

content: The app itself is great. It is however missing a lot of the drugs used at UCLA-SM
replyContent: Unfortunately, the "top 200 drugs" is not a universal list that all colleges of pharmacy use.  FlashRX uses a representative sample that cannot be comprehensive to all pharmacy programs.  The app does have functionality to add drugs that are relevant to your program, so the list can be comprehensive with some work on your part.  Thanks!

content: Ideal for students in the Pharmacy/Pharmacist field. Great study tool! Highly recommended!
